alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 5:50AM AKST until January 22 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow with visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...From Point Lay west. * WHEN...6 PM today to 3 PM Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chills to 55 below will develop this evening and continue into Friday. East winds will increase tonight and Friday with gusts to 35 mph Friday night and Saturday. This will cause blowing and drifting snow with low visibility Friday night and Saturday. Cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties.
